🚀 MIMXRT700 Peripheral Register Monitor Demonstration
============================================================

📁 File Status:
   Analysis data: complete_enhanced_peripheral_analysis.json ✅

   Clang ELF: mimxrt700evk_xspi_psram_polling_transfer_cm33_core0/armgcc/build_clang_debug/debug/xspi_psram_polling_transfer_cm33_core0.elf ❌
📊 Loading analysis data from complete_enhanced_peripheral_analysis.json
   Total accesses: 601
   Files analyzed: 7
✅ Loaded 601 register accesses

📊 PERIPHERAL ACCESS DISTRIBUTION
==================================================
Peripheral Access Counts:
   XSPI2       : 306 accesses ( 50.9%)
   CLKCTL0     : 147 accesses ( 24.5%)
   IOPCTL2     :  42 accesses (  7.0%)
   SYSCON0     :  42 accesses (  7.0%)
   RSTCTL1     :  35 accesses (  5.8%)
   IOPCTL0     :   8 accesses (  1.3%)
   CLKCTL1     :   7 accesses (  1.2%)
   RSTCTL      :   5 accesses (  0.8%)
   MPU         :   4 accesses (  0.7%)
   GPIO0       :   3 accesses (  0.5%)
   XCACHE0     :   2 accesses (  0.3%)

Execution Phase Distribution:
   runtime     : 403 accesses ( 67.1%)
   board_init  : 130 accesses ( 21.6%)
   driver_init :  68 accesses ( 11.3%)

Access Type Distribution:
   volatile_read       : 285 accesses ( 47.4%)
   volatile_write      : 207 accesses ( 34.4%)
   function_call_write : 109 accesses ( 18.1%)

🔍 BIT FIELD ANALYSIS DEMONSTRATION
==================================================

🔄 REGISTER CHANGE EXAMPLE #1
   Address: 0x40411000
   Peripheral: XSPI2
   Register: MCR
   Description: XSPI2 Module Configuration - Reset and Disable
   Before: 0x00000000 (         0)
   After:  0x00004001 (     16385)
   📝 BIT CHANGES:
      Bit  0: 0 → 1 (SWRSTSD - Software Reset for Serial Flash Memory Domain (0=Deassert, 1=Reset))
      Bit 14: 0 → 1 (MDIS - Module Disable (0=Enable clocks, 1=Allow external logic to disable clocks))

🔄 REGISTER CHANGE EXAMPLE #2
   Address: 0x40001020
   Peripheral: CLKCTL0
   Register: PSCCTL4
   Description: Clock Control - Enable System Cache
   Before: 0x00000000 (         0)
   After:  0x00000004 (         4)
   📝 BIT CHANGES:
      Bit  2: 0 → 1 (Bit 2)

🔄 REGISTER CHANGE EXAMPLE #3
   Address: 0x4000407C
   Peripheral: IOPCTL0
   Register: PIO0_31
   Description: Pin Configuration - Function 6 with pull-up
   Before: 0x00000000 (         0)
   After:  0x00000116 (       278)
   📝 BIT CHANGES:
      Bit  1: 0 → 1 (FSEL[1] - Function Selector bit 1)
      Bit  2: 0 → 1 (FSEL[2] - Function Selector bit 2)
      Bit  4: 0 → 1 (PUPDENA - Pull-up/Pull-down Enable (0=Disable, 1=Enable))
      Bit  8: 0 → 1 (DRIVE0 - Drive Strength bit 0)

🎯 CRITICAL REGISTER ANALYSIS
==================================================
Found 271 critical register writes

📋 BOARD_INIT PHASE (112 accesses):
     0: CLKCTL0  CLKSEL       - Clock source attachment
     2: CLKCTL0  CLKSEL       - Clock source attachment
     3: CLKCTL0  CLKSEL       - Clock source attachment
     6: CLKCTL0  CLKDIV       - Clock divider configuration
     7: IOPCTL0  PIO0_31      - Pin mux configuration for port 0 pin 31
   ... and 107 more accesses

📋 DRIVER_INIT PHASE (15 accesses):
     5: CLKCTL0  PSCCTL4      - Enable CLKCTL0 functionality
    10: XSPI2    MCR          - Initialize XSPI2 controller
    16: CLKCTL0  PSCCTL5      - Enable CLKCTL0 functionality
    20: XSPI2    MCR          - Initialize XSPI2 controller
    26: CLKCTL0  REG_0x40     - Enable CLKCTL0 functionality
   ... and 10 more accesses

📋 RUNTIME PHASE (144 accesses):
    55: XSPI2    MCR          - Module configuration
    60: XSPI2    MCR          - Module configuration
    65: XSPI2    MCR          - Module configuration
    75: XSPI2    MCR          - Module configuration
    85: XSPI2    MCR          - Module configuration
   ... and 139 more accesses

⚖️  TOOLCHAIN COMPARISON SIMULATION
==================================================
This simulation shows how the monitor would compare
register access patterns between GCC and Clang compiled binaries:

📊 Simulated Results:
   GCC Compiled Binary:
      Total register accesses: 601
      XSPI2 accesses: 306 (50.9%)
      CLKCTL0 accesses: 147 (24.5%)
      Initialization time: ~2.3s

   Clang Compiled Binary (projected):
      Total register accesses: 598-605 (similar)
      XSPI2 accesses: 304-308 (similar pattern)
      CLKCTL0 accesses: 145-149 (similar pattern)
      Initialization time: ~2.1-2.4s (potentially optimized)

🔍 Expected Differences:
   • Register access order may vary due to optimization
   • Some redundant accesses might be eliminated
   • Function inlining could change call stack traces
   • Overall peripheral initialization should be identical

✅ Key Validation Points:
   • Same peripheral addresses accessed
   • Same final register values achieved
   • Same hardware initialization sequence
   • Compatible with existing analysis framework

🎉 DEMONSTRATION COMPLETE
============================================================
The peripheral monitor is ready to analyze both GCC and Clang
compiled binaries when connected to actual MIMXRT700 hardware.

Next steps for real hardware testing:
1. Connect J-Link probe to MIMXRT700 target
2. Build Clang version: cd mimxrt700evk_xspi_psram_polling_transfer_cm33_core0/armgcc && make clang
3. Run monitor: python mimxrt700_peripheral_monitor.py --probe <serial> --elf <elf_file>
